meanings.definition: A person who discourages or disheartens others.
meanings.sent1: My friend is always a discouragers, telling me I can't achieve my dreams.
meanings.sent2: The discouragers in the group kept saying we would fail.
meanings.sent3: The discouragers at the party made jokes about everyone's goals.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds in the sky acted like discouragers, casting a shadow over our plans.
meanings.sent5: The discouragers in the movie were so convincing, it made me doubt myself.

meanings.definition: Things or circumstances that cause discouragement.
meanings.sent1: The constant rain was a discouragers for our outdoor picnic.
meanings.sent2: Facing so many discouragers, she almost gave up on her project.
meanings.sent3: The long line at the store was a discouragers for the shoppers.
meanings.sent4: The empty playground served as a discouragers, reminding him of happier times.
meanings.sent5: The discouragers of failure loomed over him, making it hard to stay positive.
